intro: Actinella linearifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf actinella, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Actinella linearifolia is valued for its ornamental foliage and ecological benefits, supporting various pollinators.
